answers.answer: Hello.There seems to be an issue with your back. How is your work? Do you have to strain your back too much?Alternatively, there could be a peripheral neuropathy. Have you ruled out diabetes?Regards

I have been tested for diabetes and found to be ok.I do have back problems, this has been going on for about 6 years, but for the past 2 months  the pains have been getting worse, I even fell after getting off the couch yesterday, this got me worried.

Hello.What type of back problems do you have? Was there any injury? Have you had any MRI of the back?Some backaches can be due to spasm of the spinal muscles due to faulty position. Cervical spine has to be screened for any disc bulging.Regards

I have had mri's and they found that I have stynoios at L 3,4,5 .they put me on disability april 1st 2004.I'm usually fine if I rest but now for the last 2 month I've been having these other problems, legs hurt from hips down and the small of my back, and hands . now I'm worried

follow up on question,.I all so had emg, and 3 epidurals and at that time the epidurals did not seem to help.I havnt seen a doctor for some time maybe a year ?, because all I get is pain med's I dont like the Idea ofbeing med dependent... Is there something else I can do that will help??

question: I'm a 44 year old male,  I have been experiencing a lot of pain and tinggling in my legs, back and hands.When I stand up this pain happens, and sometimes when I lay in bed.and its seems to be getting worse, what can be happening ??
title: back,leg and hand pains
